column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=custom.Span|label
#T_RL=custom.Relation|label|BT_custom.Span
#Text=O BRAUND, my Patron!
#Text=my Pleasure!
#Text=my Pride!
#Text=disdain
#Text= not to grace my Labours with a kind Perusal.
#Text=Suspend
#Text= a-while your more momentous Cares, and condescend to
#Text= taste this little _Fricassee_ of Mine.
#Text=I write not this, to Bite you by the Ear, (_i.e._)
#Text= flatter you out of a Brace or two of Guinea ' s: No;
#Text= as I am a true _Dumpling Eater_, my Views are purely
#Text= _Epicurean_, and my utmost Hopes center ' d in partaking
#Text= of some elegant _Quelque Chose_ tost up by your
#Text= judicious Hand.
#Text=I regard Money but as a Ticket which
#Text= admits me to your Delicate Entertainments; to me much
#Text= more Agreeable than all the Monkey-Tricks of Rival
#Text= _Harlequins_, or _Puppet-Show_ Finery of Contending
#Text= _Theatres_.
#Text=The Plague and fatigue of Dependance and Attendance,
#Text= which call me so often to the Court-end of the Town,
#Text= were insupportable, but for the Relief I find at
#Text= ' em a Place in History.
#Text=The Invention of Eggs was merely accidental, two or
#Text= three of which having casually roll ' d from off a Shelf
#Text= into a Pudding which a good Wife was making, she found
#Text= herself under a Necessity either of throwing away her
#Text= Pudding, or letting the Eggs remain, but concluding
#Text= from the innocent Quality of the Eggs, that they would
#Text= do no Hurt, if they did no Good.
#Text=She wisely jumbl ' d
#Text=  ' em all together, after having carefully pick ' d out
#Text= the Shells; the Consequence is easily imagined, the
#Text= Pudding became a Pudding of Puddings; and the Use of
#Text= Eggs from thence took its Date.
#Text=The Woman was sent for
#Text= to Court to make Puddings for King _John_, who then
#Text= sway ' d the Scepter; and gain ' d such Favour, that she
#Text= was the making of her whole Family.
#Text=I cannot conclude
#Text= this Paragraph without owning, I received this
#Text= important Part of the History of Pudding from old Mr.
#Text=_Lawrence_ of _Wilsden-Green_, the greatest Antiquary
#Text= of the present Age.
#Text=From that Time the _English_ became so famous for
#Text= Puddings, that they are call ' d Pudding-Eaters all over
#Text= the World, to this Day.
#Text=At her Demise, her Son was taken into Favour, and made
#Text= the King ' s chief Cook; and so great was his Fame for
#Text= Puddings, that he was call ' d _Jack Pudding_ all over
#Text= the Kingdom, tho '  in Truth, his real Name was _John
#Text= Brand_, as by the Records of the Kitchen you will
#Text= find: This _John Brand_, or _Jack-Pudding_, call him
#Text= which you please, the _French_ have it _Jean Boudin_,
#Text= for his Fame had reached _France_, whose King would
#Text= have given the World to have had our _Jack_ for his
#Text= Pudding-Maker.
#Text=This _Jack Pudding_, I say, became yet
#Text= a greater Favourite than his Mother, insomuch that he
#Text= had the King ' s Ear as well as his Mouth at Command;
#Text= for the King, you must know, was a mighty Lover of
#Text= Pudding; and _Jack_ fitted him to a Hair, he knew how
#Text= to make the most of a Pudding; no Pudding came amiss
#Text=always wore as a Mark of his Sovereign ' s Favour; in
#Text= short, _Jack Pudding_, or Sir _John_, grew to be all
#Text= in all with good King _John_; he did nothing without
#Text= him, they were Finger and Glove; and, if we may
#Text= believe Tradition, our very good Friend had no small
#Text= Hand in the _Magna Charta_.
#Text=If so, how much are all
#Text= _Englishmen_ indebted to him?
#Text=in what Repute ought the
#Text= Order of the Gridiron to be, which was instituted to
#Text= do Honour to this Wonderful Man?
#Text=But alas!
#Text=how soon is
#Text= Merit forgot?
#Text=how impudently do the Vulgar turn the
#Text= most serious Things into Ridicule, and mock the most
#Text= solemn Trophies of Honour?
#Text=for now every Fool at a
#Text= Fair, or Zany at a Mountebank ' s Stage, is call ' d _Jack
#Text= Pudding_, has a Gridiron at his Back, and a great Pair
#Text= of Spectacles at his Buttocks, to ridicule the most
#Text= noble Order of the Gridiron.
#Text=But their Spectacles is a
#Text= most ungrateful Reflection on the Memory of that great
#Text= Man, whose indefatigable Application to his Business,
#Text= and deep Study in that occult Science, rendred him
#Text= Poreblind; to remedy which Misfortune, he had always a
#Text=Obligation was over: Which made Sir _John_ compose
#Text= that excellent Proverb, _Not a word of the Pudding_.
#Text=And finding all Means ineffectual, he left the Court
#Text= in a great Pet; yet not without passing a severe Joke
#Text= upon  ' em, in his way, which was this; He sent a
#Text= Pudding to the King ' s Table, under the Name of a
#Text= _Court-Pudding_, or _Promise-Pudding_.
#Text=This Pudding he
#Text= did not fail to set off with large Encomiums; assuring
#Text= the King, That therein he wou ' d find an Hieroglyphical
#Text= Definition of Courtiers Promises and Friendship.
#Text=This caused some Speculation; and the King ' s Physician
#Text= debarr ' d the King from tasting the Pudding, not
#Text= knowing but that Sir _John_ had poison ' d it.
#Text=But how great a Fit of Laughter ensu ' d, may be easily
#Text= guess ' d, when the Pudding was cut up, it prov ' d only a
#Text= large Bladder, just clos ' d over with Paste: The
#Text= Bladder was full of Wind, and nothing else, excepting
#Text= these Verses written in a Roll of Paper, and put in,
#Text=executed, so not one of the King ' s Cooks cou ' d make a
#Text= Pudding like Sir _John_; nay, tho '  he made a Pudding
#Text= before their Eyes, yet they out of the very same
#Text= Materials could not do the like.
#Text=Which made his old
#Text= Friends the Monks attribute it to Witchcraft, and it
#Text= was currently reported the Devil was his Helper.
#Text=But
#Text= good King _Harry_ was not to be fobb ' d off so; the
#Text= Pudding was good, it sate very well on his Stomach,
#Text= and he eat very savourly, without the least Remorse of
#Text= Conscience.
#Text=In short, Sir _John_ grew in Favour in spite of their
#Text= Teeth: The King lov ' d a merry Joke; and Sir _John_ had
#Text= always his Budget full of Punns, Connundrums and
#Text= Carrawitchets; not to forgot the Quibbles and
#Text= Fly-flaps he play ' d against his Adversaries, at which
#Text= the King has laugh ' d  ' till his Sides crackt.
#Text=Sir _John_, tho '  he was no very great Scholar, yet had
#Text= a happy way of Expressing himself: He was a Man of the
#Text=most Engaging Address, and never fail ' d to draw
#Text= Attention: Plenty and Good-Nature smil ' d in his Face;
#Text= his Muscles were never distorted with Anger or
#Text= Contemplation, but an eternal Smile drew up the
#Text= Corners of his Mouth; his very Eyes laugh ' d; and as
#Text= for his Chin it was three-double, a-down which hung a
#Text= goodly Whey-colour ' d Beard shining with the Drippings
#Text= of his Luxury; for you must know he was a great
#Text= Epicure, and had a very Sensible Mouth; he thought
#Text= nothing too-good for himself, all his Care was for his
#Text= Belly; and his Palate was so exquisite, that it was
#Text= the perfect Standard of Tasting.
#Text=So that to him we owe
#Text= all that is elegant in Eating: For Pudding was not his
#Text= only Talent, he was a great Virtuoso in all manner of
#Text= Eatables; and tho '  he might come short of _Lambert_
#Text= for Confectionary-Niceties, yet was he not inferiour
#Text= to _Brawnd_, _Lebec_, _Pede_, or any other great
#Text= Masters of Cookery; he could toss up a Fricassée as
#Text= well as a Pancake: And most of the Kickshaws now in
#Text= vogue, are but his Inventions, with other Names; for
#Text=Life, is, properly speaking, a Bak ' d Wheat-Pudding.
#Text=To the Satchel, which is the Pudding-Bag of Ingenuity,
#Text= we are indebted for the greatest Men in Church and
#Text= State.
#Text=All Arts and Sciences owe their Original to
#Text= Pudding or Dumpling.
#Text=What is a Bag-Pipe, the Mother of
#Text= all Music, but a Pudding of Harmony.
#Text=And what is Music
#Text= it self, but a Palatable Cookery of Sounds.
#Text=To little
#Text= Puddings or Bladders of Colours we owe all the choice
#Text= Originals of the Greatest Painters: And indeed, what
#Text= is Painting, but a well-spread Pudding, or Cookery of
#Text= Colours.
#Text=The Head of Man is like a Pudding: And whence have all
#Text= Rhimes, Poems, Plots and Inventions sprang, but from
#Text= that same Pudding.
#Text=What is Poetry, but a Pudding of
#Text= Words.
#Text=The Physicians, tho '  they cry out so much
#Text= against Cooks and Cookery, yet are but Cooks
#Text= themselves; with this difference only, the Cooks
#Text= Pudding lengthens Life, the Physicians shortens it.
#Text=So that we Live and Die by Pudding.
#Text=For what is a
#Text= Clyster, but a Bag-Pudding; a Pill, but a Dumpling;
#Text= or a Bolus, but a Tansy, tho '  not altogether so
#Text= Toothsome.
#Text=In a word; Physick is only a Puddingizing
#Text= or Cookery of Drugs.
#Text=The Law is but a Cookery of
#Text= Quibbles and Contentions.
#Text= * * * * * * is but a Pudding of * * * * * * * * *
#Text= * * *.
#Text=Some swallow every thing whole and unmix ' d;
#Text= so that it may rather be call ' d a Heap, than a
#Text= Pudding.
#Text=Others are so Squeamish, the greatest
#Text= Mastership in Cookery is requir ' d to make the Pudding
#Text= Palatable: The Suet which others gape and swallow by
#Text= Gobs, must for these puny Stomachs be minced to Atoms;
#Text= the Plums must be pick ' d with the utmost Care, and
#Text= every Ingredient proportion ' d to the greatest Nicety,
#Text= or it will never go down.
#Text=[Footnote a: _The Cat run away with this part
#Text=_Prior_ gave him Ease, by furnishing him with the Word
#Text= _Connoissance_.
#Text=Our D--n had drawn a Drole, Parallel
#Text= to this, _viz._ _Boudineur_, a Pudding Pyeman; and
#Text= _Boudinance_, the making of Pudding Pies: But several
#Text= Men of Quality begging it off, it was, at their
#Text= Request, scratch ' d out, but my Friend, the
#Text= _Amanuensis_, remembers particularly its being
#Text= originally inserted.
#Text=If the Reader should ask, Who is that K-- _John_
#Text= mentioned in the fourth Page, and which I ought to
#Text= have taken in its Place.
#Text=I beg leave to inform him,
#Text= that by K.
#Text=_John_ is meant the late Q. ----, with whom
#Text= the D-- of _M----_ was many Years in such great
#Text= Favour, that he was nick named K.
#Text=_John_; it was in
#Text= that Part of the Q-- ' s Reign, that Sir _John_ Pudding,
#Text= by whom is meant **** _you know who_, came in Favour;
#Text= it is true, the Name is odd, and seems to carry an Air
#Text= of Ridicule with it, but the Character given him by
#Text= this allegorical Writer, is that of an able Statesman,
#Text=and an honest Man.
#Text=And here, begging Mr.
#Text=D--n ' s Pardon, I cannot but
#Text= think his Wit has out run his Judgment; for he puts
#Text= the Cart before the Horse, and begins at the latter
#Text= Part of Sir **** Administration: But this might be
#Text= owing to too plentiful a Dinner, and too much of the
#Text= Creature.
#Text=Be that as it will, I must follow my Copy,
#Text= and explain it as it lies.
#Text=Proceed we therefore to the
#Text= Dissertation, _Page 6._
#Text=
#Text= "But what rais ' d our Hero most in the Esteem of this
#Text= Pudding-eating Monarch, was his second Edition of
#Text= Pudding, he being the first that ever invented the Art
#Text= of broiling Puddings, which he did to such Perfection,
#Text= and so much to the King ' s liking (who had a mortal
#Text= Aversion to cold Pudding) that he thereupon instituted
#Text= him Knight of the Gridiron, and gave him a Gridiron of
#Text= Gold, the Ensign of that Order; which he always wore
#Text= as a Mark of his Sovereign ' s Favour."
#Text=sometimes Twenty-Years backwards, at other Times
#Text= advancing as many; so that one knows not where to have
#Text= him: for in his fifteenth Page, he returns to the
#Text= present Scene of Action, and brings his Hero into the
#Text= Favour of K---- _Harry_, _alias_ **** who being
#Text= sensible of his Abilities, restores him into Favour,
#Text= and makes Use of his admirable Skill in Cookery,
#Text= _alias_ State Affairs.
#Text="Not one of the King ' s Cooks could make a Pudding like
#Text= Sir _John_; nay, though he made a Pudding before their
#Text= Eyes, yet they, out of the very same Materials, could
#Text= not do the like: Which made his old Friends, the
#Text= Monks, attribute it to Witchcraft and it was currently
#Text= reported the Devil was his Helper.
